title: ORT charges (San Bernardino County District Attorney)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From 1/1/2019-3/11/2025, for any case where any one of the following penal code
sections were charged: 490.4 (a), 459.5, 484(a) – (and whether the special
allegation of 490.2 was alleged), the following statistical information:
- Date of filing
- Additional charges
- Age of the defendant at the time of the crime
- Race/national origin/ethnicity
- Gender
- Outcome proceeding type + date
- Outcome (dismissal, sentence, etc)
- Amount of theft if entered in PIMS

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a copy of the most recent fiscal year budget, as well as any budgetary documents related to capital purchasing and outstanding liabilities such as bonds.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Transparency in Government

title: Correspondence between Indiana State Police, Carroll County Sheriff’s Office, and Jeffrey Turco

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Correspondence between Indiana State Police, Carroll County Sheriff’s Office, and Jeffrey Turco
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails, including attachments, sent To, CC’d, or BCC’d to jturco@purdue.edu from the domain “isp.in.gov” that contain the words “report,” “interview,” “meeting,” “defense,” “Buckley,” “Turco,” “Holeman,” “Liggett,” “investigation,” “Indiana,” “ISP,” or “Odinism” from May 1, 2023 to October 31, 2023. 

Emails, including attachments, sent To, CC’d, or BCC’d to the domain “isp.in.gov” from jturco@purdue.edu that contain the words “report,” “interview,” “meeting,” “defense,” “Buckley,” “Turco,” “Holeman,” “Liggett,” “investigation,” “Indiana,” “ISP,” or “Norse” from May 1, 2023 to October 31, 2023. 

Emails, including attachments, sent To, CC’d, or BCC’d to jturco@purdue.edu from the domain “cacoshrf.com” that contain the words “report,” “interview,” “meeting,” “defense,” “Buckley,” “Turco,” “Holeman,” “Liggett,” “investigation,” “Indiana,” “ISP,” “Carroll County,” or “Odinism” from May 1, 2023 to October 31, 2023. 

Emails, including attachments, sent To, CC’d, or BCC’d to the domain “cacoshrf.com” from jturco@purdue.edu that contain the words “report,” “interview,” “meeting,” “defense,” “Buckley,” “Turco,” “Holeman,” “Liggett,” “investigation,” “Indiana,” “ISP,” “Carroll County,” or “Norse” from May 1, 2023 to October 31, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carl McGehee
